posts._title: Juliet Berto & Jean-Henri Roger – Neige AKA Snow [+Extra] (1981)
posts.title: Neige
posts.excerpt: Quote:An illustration of the more or less weird people in the nightlife of the revel region of a French town. In the center of the (almost non-existing) plot are barmaid Anita and a reverend. Anita cares for the Caribbean dealer Bobby like a mother, but he’s too cool to listen to her warnings. When he’s …

posts.title: Shaka Zulu
posts.excerpt: Framed around Queen Victoria’s decision on England’s political stance towards the Zulu Nation, this mini-series details King Shaka’s rise and fall with mythic detail. Prophecy is mixed with recorded fact regarding Shaka’s birth, exile, innovations in warfare, assumption of the throne, building of the Zulu Empire, first contact with Europe and the events that lead …

posts.title: O Henry’s Full House
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:John Steinbeck introduces five of O. Henry’s most popular short stores in this anthology film. In “The Cop and the Anthem” a homeless alcoholic is increasingly frustrated in numerous attempts to get arrested and jailed for 90 days in a warm cell rather than face the rigors of a New York winter. In “The Clarion …

posts._title: Jørgen Leth – At danse Bournonville AKA Dancing Bournonville (1979)
posts.title: At danse Bournonville
posts.excerpt: At danse Bournonville is a portrait of the Bournonville tradition at the Royal Danish ballet that has survived for 150 years on the basis of a few notes and the memories of the dancers and is the basis of the special nature and global reputation the company enjoys. The film was created in continuation of, …

posts.title: Inside Job
posts.excerpt: Quote:Charles Ferguson’s “Inside Job” is strong, fair, and rational. The director tries mightily to untangle the complex architecture of the financial meltdown that has cost millions their jobs, their homes, and their savings. If you consider skipping it because it sounds boring, please think again. My blood is still boiling.

posts._title: Woody Allen – Everyone Says I Love You (1996)
posts.title: Everyone Says I Love You
posts.excerpt: Quote:A New York girl sets her father up with a beautiful woman in a troubled marriage while her stepsister gets engaged.

posts._title: Andrzej Zulawski – L’Important c’est d’aimer AKA That Most Important Thing: Love (1975)
posts.title: L’Important c’est d’aimer
posts.excerpt: Quote:Andrzej Zulawski’s L’important c’est d’aimer is a film of dishevelled lyricism, bursting with noise and anger; an insane storm-tainted flamboyant opera; a visual symphony with apocalyptic emphasis featuring sleaze-bags, clowns, drop-outs, wimps, bastards, and “puppet shows depicting lives of complete scoundrels and ruined careers.” Where some people will see nothing but a graphic canvas of …

posts.title: Shakespeare-Wallah
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Lizzie (Felicity Kendal) is an actress in a Shakespearean theater troupe that has seen better days. The troupe tours India to dwindling crowds who are less interested in all things British in the wake of Indian independence. When she has an affair with the Indian playboy Sanju (Shashi Kapoor), Lizzie feels the wrath of her …

posts._title: Spike Lee – When the Levees Broke: A Requiem in Four Acts [+ Epilogue] (2006)
posts.title: When the Levees Broke: A Requiem in Four Acts [+ Epilogue]
posts.excerpt: SynopsisSpike Lee’s award-winning documentary follows the events that preceded and followed Hurricane Katrina’s catastrophic passage through New Orleans in 2005.

posts._title: Sergio Cabrera – Perder es cuestión de método AKA The Art of Losing (2004)
posts.title: Perder es cuestión de método
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A body is discovered impaled on a stake near a scenic lake near Bogota. A journalist tries to find what happened. With a friend, they set about to find the cause of the crime and uncover an intricate real estate fraud involving corrupt politicians, emerald hunters, nudists.
